website_summaries.verdict: The Moto G7 is the best budget phone we've tried hands down.
pros: The Motorola Moto G7 has a slick contemporary design, a dewdrop notch display, decent dual rear cameras, turbo charging, solid battery life and a near-stock version of Android 9 Pie making it worth every penny
cons: The single speaker is merely serviceable, low-light photos and general video quality isn't fantastic and the phone costs $50 more than last year's Moto G6

customer_reviews.title: Amazon broke a great phone Moto G7
customer_reviews.text: Amazon Alexa support confirms there is a product defect with this item. Many people are having the same problem. Problem appears when the internal storage reaches 100% - the phone fails to properly use SD card internal storage. Return if you still can. Storage says it's only 21% full but "Storage space is running out. Some system functions may not work.". Motorola's second level tech support says the software isn't working. Apparently the mods Amazon made to force their software from being removed broke the file management for the Moto G7 :-(
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth A.

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, but size......
customer_reviews.text: This is a great upgrade from G6. Loved the crisp display and speed (better than G6). Moto could have easily become the best not only in the league but could have flaunted with big 3 too. A little more RAM and a 670 processor (very minimum) could have been better. Size of the phone has gone bigger from G6. It should have gone the other-way around. They could have cut some cost by either maintaining the same size as G6 or Pixel phone size. Used that budget for RAM and processor. I love this phone, great work by Moto, but I still will return it due to its size & RAM. I don't think you'd repent buying this phone!
customer_reviews.author: Sriram R. Krishnan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with Verizon
customer_reviews.text: I swapped out an older E4 plus with this phone over the weekend. The phone would only connect @ 3G speeds to Verizon's US network. I reset the network, factory reset the phone and had Verizon replace the SIM this AM. The Verizon rep said that this phone wasn't compatible with their network. Don't buy this phone if you have Verizon.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Bloss

customer_reviews.title: Reviewing Amazon's selling "unlocked" phones - not the phone itself
customer_reviews.text: Needed to get a basic smartphone for an elderly relative who doesn't have access to the internet for a couple of months and really misses having access to Alexa. Thought this would be perfect, except it doesn't work. Phone is not unlocked and can't be used to access the internet. Wasted a few very precious hours dealing with AT&T (very helpful) and Amazon (CLUELESS) tech support. Can return the phone for free but will have to pay shipping to return the case. All in all a very frustrating experience and I highly recommend you do not buy anything listed as unlocked on Amazon as there clearly is no testing process in place and they don't value your time.
customer_reviews.author: N. K. Sakelaris

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is quite a leap from my Moto G5. Reddit is fast. Google Assistant is quite responsive. Autodesk Sketchbook is more fun to draw with. Lots of screen real estate. The extra speed and pixels are worthb the price. When I double-chop to light up the torch I whisper "Lumos!"
customer_reviews.author: Justin Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!!
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed in this purchase! I can't enjoy any of the features necause the phone goes to sleep in 3-5 seconds and I have to continuously press the power button to wake it up. This is regardles of what the display settings are. I'm currently set to time out in 5 minutes...NEVER does that happen. It's very annoying. Shame on me because I googles the issue after the fact and found I'm not the only one with this problem. Apparently it's a flaw in this model. I cannot seem to get any repair shops to rectify the problem. Probably gonna refund this item!
customer_reviews.author: Grady L. Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Best phone for the money
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned a Moto G4. The G7 has cutting edge technology with the latest Oreo operating system. The new snapdragon cpu can handle very demanding games. The camera takes clear, beautiful pics. The phone has facial recognition which works surprisingly well. I compared my phone to a 800.00 Samsung phone my friend had, and the Moto G7 not only looked better, it ran smoother.
customer_reviews.author: Sean K.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I just upgraded from the Moto g6 I got last summer and I have to say I love this phone. It's super fast and the screen is slightly upgraded from last year's g6 model I highly recommend this phone if you are looking for a nice android phone for a good price the only thing I don't like about it is that the speaker is bottom firing and the fingerprint sensor is on the back but it's 19:9 display that was to be expected
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great phone
customer_reviews.text: I just received this phone and the design is amazing. It looks and works great. Not super big but a tad larger than my g6. Thank you for this cool phone!
customer_reviews.author: D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this phone, but ....
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this phone, but I'm finding lots of issues. The internet connection lags no matter where I'm at, even using WiFi. When I'm on speaker phone, people say that I cut in and out. I thought it was just me, but apparently other people are having the same issues. I'm so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: RBaker

customer_reviews.title: Far below par from expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I'm heartbroken. Age doing the research I thought this was going to be the best phone for my buck. I was so excited to get it but the battery dies too quickly, the face recognition doesn't work well, the phone keeps turning itself on and now all my apps keep crashing. I wish I'd paid closer attention to when I bought it so I could have returned it within 30 days of buying it.
customer_reviews.author: E.V.Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware !!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this phone to replace my Samsung Galaxy note 4 and the payment option to get it but I am not impressed. It is laggy, The sound is not very loud, I have to talk on speaker most the time just to hear, I have no GPS in my house or in most houses or buildings, the screen is so much smaller then my note 4, The battery does hold a charge for a day but that is about the best feature of this phone. I will be sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: I have had nothing but issues. The phone shuts off for who knows what reason, Amazon of course closes the return window very quickly - by the time I got the Sim card and Verizon activated the device, I was out of town working and the return window closed. Motorola is replacing the device (supposedly) but I don't have a lot of faith that the replacement is going to be any better than the original. If I could go back I would Pony up and get a Samsung or Apple Phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life & Beautiful Screen
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting a larger screen for sometime, but stuck with the Moto G5 Plus until now. The screen is beautiful. In fact it looks just as good as many of the incredibly expensive premium phones to me. The battery life so far is great as well. I unplug it in the morning and never think about charging it until bed time. I still have just over 50% left with moderate to heavy use throughout the day. Not something that's important to me, but worth noting that there is no NFC chip if you're someone who uses mobile payments.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Solid phone priced right
customer_reviews.text: The Moto G7 power is a great phone at an even better price. It has a huge battery that does not increase the device size significantly, it has the latest Android flavor, and is pretty zippy. And is $250. The previous reviews that said it didn't come with features that it clearly did not state it had or someone complaining about the lack of a $7 case or headphones are ridiculous. This phone is EXACTLY what Moto says it is. A very good phone for a very good price with a very good battery.
customer_reviews.author: Pete W

customer_reviews.title: Think twice before you buy.
customer_reviews.text: This phone has problems connecting to my wifi. It drops wifi for no reason. It doesn't make use of my 5g wifi connection. It only finds a 2.4g speed. It also struggles with the internet in general. I have Verizon. No reason for that.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Devlin

customer_reviews.title: Voice Only
customer_reviews.text: So far, it doesn't support cell phone Data using the Sprint (CDMA) network through Ting. They seem baffled, that it's only working for voice. Now I'm waiting for Ting to send a GSM sim card to see if data will work on the T-Mobile network. Update: Received a new GSM SIM card and now it's working fine. I have no complaints, seems like a fine phone.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: TMobile users beware...
customer_reviews.text: This does not work on all TMobile networks. Purchased this phone for my husband. The only thing he can consistently use it for is calls. Text messaging and anything that uses data (i.e., maps, Facebook, Messenger, or anything you would need "internet" for) do not work unless he uses WiFi. Which isn't always available when he's not home. He actually loves the phone's user interface, but not being able to use the phone for normal functions is frustrating. Giving low stars mainly because the description is misleading and the seller should fix this to keep people from wasting their money by being forthcoming about it's limitations on certain networks.
customer_reviews.author: The Realist

customer_reviews.title: Phone service unstable. Not sure what to do.
customer_reviews.text: I dont know if it's only me but the internet is unstable on this phone. My other phone I had more bars.and it didn't go up and down. Not sure what to do. Other then that it's amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: RE:  CONSTANT CONNECTION ISSUES
customer_reviews.text: I keep having connection issues and I am on TMobile. This phone is having problem sending texts even though I have a great signal and network. It is also dropping calls and not permitting calls to be made. Something is wrong with this Moto Power...the only good thing is battery is great.
customer_reviews.author: Jd

customer_reviews.title: Big Screen
customer_reviews.text: I've only had the phone for a few days but seems to be a big upgrade from the Motorola G6
customer_reviews.author: Todd66

customer_reviews.title: I had to return it
customer_reviews.text: It looks like i got a unit which had some hardware or software issues since it randomly shut itself down on the average twice a day. Used it for 8 days and could not figure out what caused the problem. So it was returned. Other than this issue i liked the phone a lot. For now i keep my Moto G5 plus a while longer.
customer_reviews.author: tom zsarnoczay

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed With The Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting the battery life to be great, but compared to my iphone 7 this battery is pretty sub par. It might beat out the iphone 7 in terms of charge speed, but I don't have issues planning to charge my phone. For all the praise I've seen about this phone's battery life, I feel disappointed. The haptic feedback feels bad compared to the iphone 7 also. The screen is nice to look at and it's nice and large. I do enjoy the Android OS a lot more than iOS as it feels less restrictive. If I knew what I know about this phone I would look for another phone with the Android OS.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Tortino

customer_reviews.title: GREAT! smartphone without breaking the bank
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone to use with straight talk. I put my old SIM card in and I was done. The device is great... Quite an upgrade from my old phone. UI took about a day to completely figure out which for me is very acceptable. Screen clarity is great. My games look much smoother now. The sound is loud and clear. So far this device is perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Breed

customer_reviews.title: Dnt buy it pls
customer_reviews.text: So the battery life is bad. I can not even explain it. Let's just say u need to walk with a charger 24/7. The Alexa hands free is not even hands free. The inbuilt Alexa is worse. The email section for the Moto is (hell) if u have multiple emails good luck. It will not show u the emails it's like ghost town. The apps section😬😬. Nothing work's with this Moto phone. Am looking for another phone. Do not waste ur money
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Switching from iphone to this
customer_reviews.text: I was worried just a little about moving from an iphone to android. However, I did my research and the switch has not been as difficult as I thought it would be. Adjusting to new or different functions has been a fairly easy transition.
customer_reviews.author: eallen

customer_reviews.title: think before you buy this cheaply made piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: This phone is a cheaply made piece of junk. unfortunately i had a a family emergency and had to wait to try it out . i missed being able to return it . it won't easily turn on or off, reboots and does weird things. The camera and recording device work when they want to and i missed a lot of concert footage. It loses internet connection and there is nothing wrong with my internet on any of my other devices . $200 wasted on a piece of junk that i am stuck with . The charger doesn't seem to fit well and i doubt it will last long .. Buyer beware. I am extremely unhappy with this purchase.

customer_reviews.text: Moto G7,,,,,The phone would not work after 3 days. customer_reviews.title: Donkeys aren't good pets...  ? Garbage

customer_reviews.title: Great phone
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical but it surpassed my expectations. The price is great for what you are getting. The fingerprint reader is right on. To unlock you just let it read your fingerprint and it unlocks quickly. It's a great phone. Resolution is amazing. Crisp and clean. Very responsive. Have had no issues. No lag. No downtime. No weird restarts. Nothing. Just a pleasure to sue. The moto gestures are great too. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Marius

customer_reviews.title: Great battery and value
customer_reviews.text: The most outstanding feature of the Moto G7 Power is its battery, which can easily last 2-3 days of regular use before needing some time on the included USB-C rapid charger. The features on the three generations of Motorola smartphones I've owned so far have never left me envious of the $1,000+ flagships my friends buy. Unless you're a pro photographer or want to play the most graphically sophisticated mobile games, the Moto G7 Power should suit your needs at a low price point.
customer_reviews.author: David G

customer_reviews.title: Whatcha doing buying those expensive phones?
customer_reviews.text: We are Moto phone people obviously as we started with the old flip RazR phones! We have gone through Moto E, X,G 4 plus and now G7. The G7 is my new $900 phone, HA! It does everything those flagships do for waaay less $. Don't hesitate, the display, battery life, feel, build, is just tops. The only downside to my usage so far is the selfie camera, it could be much better. Other than that, sarisfied.
customer_reviews.author: it's me

customer_reviews.title: Happily surprised.
customer_reviews.text: I've always had the popular device such as the newest iPhone or Samsung and with those comes the huge price. I decided to give this phone a chance. I was extremely surprised. While it doesn't have the best camera or fastest processor it is an excellent phone. It has a great feel and hasn't given me any issues such as freezing or lag. You can't beat this phone in the price range. It will do most anything you ask without an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: I like it more than my galaxyS7
customer_reviews.text: I used a galaxy S7 until the display quit working and found this phone. I love it so far. Pros- ON sale atm. $180 is a great deal. -performs well and 64GB internal storage -this is the flagship version (G7 power and G7 play are cheaper versions)though the best is G7+ but not by much. -PLUGNPLAY; I popped in my Verizon sim and that was it. -Speaker is better than my Galaxy S7 Con- -Some Users are reporting wifi issues..😱 I will update if I do in the future. -NOT waterproof..I'm going to miss that. -No wireless charging -will try to find more
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Nice, NICE MOTO G7
customer_reviews.text: Wish txt came with phone explaining all it can do. Phone locked on me when setting up fingerprint & password. Did them both but phone wouldn't open without an ID. Huh? Gave it password & print. Had to get it reset to factory condition by tech person, but was annoying & scary to be without a working phone for a week. Battery charge started out FANTASTIC - didn't have to recharge till top of third day. Now I have to charge daily. Why? Great screen clarity..colors nicely saturated + images sharp! Love! Don't know why I wasn't offered the option to purchase an extended warranty at time of purchase tho...a bit of discomfort without that extra protection.
customer_reviews.author: CATherine H.

customer_reviews.title: Angry fan rant
customer_reviews.text: Motorola doesn't honor their warranty. Or at least Amazon doesn't. I bought this phone last yr. The speaker went out and the only way people can hear me is if I put it on speaker. This happened before my screen cracked. They won't give me a new phone. Screen cracking isn't part of their warranty. I've BEEN a Motorola fan for YEARS. I always bragged on them. Until now. Slimy business practice. Don't advertise US warranty if you're NOT going to honor it. You'll be lucky I give you my money for a Moto One Zoom at $350 or a G8 Power when it releases. Let us pre-order already.
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: Such a great phone for the money
customer_reviews.text: I use this phone with Republic Wireless service and both are great values. The G7 has just enough features for me to get everything out of my phone that I want. Battery life has been good so far. The only thing I'm not sure about is the way the top notification bar "detours" around the front camera. It's a little odd to me but not something that would change my mind about purchasing this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Dave from CA

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I received it the next day and installed my Verizon sim and boom, ready to go. Don't let the 720p screen turn you away. It is plenty for a cell phone. Alexa isn't intrusive either. I do recommend getting a case as it's pretty slippery.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressed, reception quality gets a letter grade of D
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my Samsung S6 with this G7. So, that's what I am comparing it to. Reception gets a D, terrible, terrible, terrible. Camera quality gets a C. Ability to send pictures in an e-mail, D- (again, related to reception). Battery life gets a C. Overall, I am not impressed with this phone and don't recommend it. I've had for 10 months now and am looking for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: WhiteyPLS

customer_reviews.title: Performance degrades over time
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally broke my previous phone and immediately needed a new one. With some search and reviews I went for this. I am using the phone since a week and not regretting the purchase, rather I am happy about it. Loved the look and feel of the mobile. Performance is also good considering the RAM/CPU it has. Alexa Hands-Free is added advantage. However, I feel thew regular price for this is little on higher side. Edit 1: Battery started draining faster after initial 3 months of usage. Edit 2: Phone is getting hung sometime after around 6 month of usage
customer_reviews.author: Pradeep Agrawal

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't working with T-Mobile, finally is
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking phone, just spent an hour on phone with T-Mobile support, can't get it to connect to data. I need a functioning phone now. Not Happy! Update, it took 12 hours and way too much time with T-MOBILE tech but it is finally connecting to data and seems to be functioning. Further update:. I looked at several phones, chose this more expensive one due to claims of longer battery life. Even on battery saver, it goes from. 100 percent to 10 percent within 2 hours.
customer_reviews.author: BAK

customer_reviews.title: A clear winner from Motorola!
customer_reviews.text: This is an upgrade from the the excellent G5+ for me and it's such a great phone! The screen is bright, the phone is smooth looking and just as thin as it should be to feel comfortable in my hand. It's fast and without any operational flaws. It works perfectly with my carrier Ting. Even WiFi calling works flawlessly. The camera is good and calls are clear. What more could I ask for? I just do not understand why I would spend a grand on a phone when I can have this for a third of the price. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Christian Dysthe

customer_reviews.title: Bad reception
customer_reviews.text: I got terrible reception with a new unbranded Moto g7, which I bought to replace an older moto g. I put the chip back in my old moto g and got average reception. And by bad, I mean 1 bar to none in my house. I bought a Iphone the day after for triple the money. I received a solid 3 to 4 bars of LTE where my old moto g received just 1 or 2 of 3g. I wish motorolla could figure out the ongoing problem. Lots of reviews with the same problem. I have been a loyal Moto fan, but they may have lost me forever.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Amazon ads are so frequent it is impossible to use the phone.
customer_reviews.text: When trying to use the phone for any real business the phone interupts with an ad trying to get a sale for some stupid game or another. No way to turn these ads off and with the constant interuptions it makes the phone unusable. It does not interupt when actually talking on the phone but will interupt when trying to dial. A worthless piece of SH**.
customer_reviews.author: LAN

customer_reviews.title: Moto G 7 64 GB
customer_reviews.text: Luv the Moto Gs.. Had Orig. G5-plus and now G7.. But this one G7 (started about 2-mos. after I got it) has been sporadically, Not waking up when I pick it up. Like it's dead, battery has been between 50 and 79%.. Once I plug it in and get it to wake up.. NOW since Feb. 13, 20, has been saying NO SD Card, missing.. 64 GB, Have taken in an out, restarted, turned off/on, turned off over night still says NO Card.. Waiting for New SD Card, ordered from Amazon, as I ordered the orig. one and the MOTO G7. Any one else have this problem? Thanks..
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Moto g7
customer_reviews.text: The Moto g7 is a decent phone with consistent performance and quality. To increase the speed go to Settings, Accessibility, Remove animations, Turn On. Warning! Be careful the Moto g7 International models are different and are not intended for the United States. International models are missing some 4G bands for the five networks (AT&T, Sprint, T-Mobile, US Cellular, and Verizon) in the United States.
customer_reviews.author: Paul G

customer_reviews.title: horrible phone
customer_reviews.text: would have give it a 4-5 star but nope this phone turn the brightness way down at random. i was reading stuff and it turn the brightness all the way down. so freaking annoying. the worse thing it doesnt let me use my data. for some reason i only able to use facebook everything else doesnt work. and i even bought a case for this crap mad!! update: finally figured out how to get the mobile data but the lighting situation hasnt fix yet so 3 start for now
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Android for your money
customer_reviews.text: Why spend hundred of dollars on a phone when you can get this one that has everything you need. This is my second Motorola and it is even better than the last one. Bought this particular one for my son who is a computer science major and he actually requested it. Some don't like pre-loaded Amazon but I don't mind one bit because I would have loaded them anyway. I've had mine for almost a year and my son got this one. We are both pleased with it and have not run into any issues. I don't think it has face recognition but I don't care. Finger print is just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Prvbswmn

customer_reviews.title: It is exactly what I thought it would be
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace a Moto G5+. In the same model case it's about 10mm longer than the old phone but equal the other ways, yet has a far larger screen, which I like. Fingerprint reader is much smaller but quite effective. Has not missed yet. I don't do face recognition so can't comment on that. Batter life is shorter than the G5, as I expected, but for my use case that means sometimes I charge it every second day instead of every third. Heavy users will likely charge it daily. The camera is better, but don't expect a pocket dSLR. In all, it's exactly what I expected it would be, and probably the best budget smartphone on the market.
customer_reviews.author: David Barker

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware, super fragile phone
customer_reviews.text: This phone is by far the worst, most fragile phone I've ever owned! In all my years of owning smartphones I have never even cracked a screen and we busted 2 of these phones (we purchased a 2nd one for my husband) within a month of purchase, paid $100 to get screen repaired and it IMMEDIATLY cracked again, even in a case . Upon further research it seems this particular model is known for how fragile they are.
customer_reviews.author: Siirena

customer_reviews.title: Battery seem to drain faster then my Moto G5 Plus
customer_reviews.text: I just got the Moto G7 during Amazon Prime Day. Overall it is a good phone. I have not yet installed all the apps that I had on the old phone onto this one - I do not have that many apps nor am I a heavy gaming or streaming user, but I am noticing that the battery is draining faster than my old phone. So am disappointed. I am not sure if I got a defective phone. Will wait to see how it performs in a week or two. For now giving it a 3 and will update in a few weeks if the phone does good! Update: Battery is still an issue!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Moto G7
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this phone is amazing, one thing I like is its 64gb of space. Perfect for someone that demands space. I also love about this phone.... It's unlocked. I'm using Total Wireless and works great. Processing speed a plus, also in view picture of vid playing while reading or surfing the web. Great options and still finding more about the phone. Feels solid and I do recommend a case. The phone feels slick and can slide of your hands finger if not paying attention. Oops there goes your phone. To my surprise I did drop my phone around 2 1/2 feet and to my surprise I found it still in one piece.
customer_reviews.author: Rocco

customer_reviews.title: G7 To the rescue!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to upgrade my G4 which I had for three years. This phone is quick and I love the bells and whistles. The cost was reasonable and it is an unlocked phone....HOWEVER, BOOST MOBILE no longer supports Motorola G7 phones...or at least that is what I was told by their customer service. They are no longer supporting this phone BUT...it was still showing on their list of phones the last time I checked. I suggest you call your carrier to find out if this phone will work as a "bring your own phone" on their service.
customer_reviews.author: Jackieofalltrades

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a non tech savvy gal.
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone. I'm not the type of person to get the latest gadget and prefer buying something more bang for my buck. The only thing I dislike about this phone is the placement of the fingerprint scanner, and Motorola signage at the bottom of the screen. The screen quality is good but not great. I use to have a iPhone SE and it finally died on me. It was an adjustment getting use to the size difference. I decided not to get an apple because of the life expectancy and cost wasn't reasonable to me.
customer_reviews.author: meemeiu

customer_reviews.title: This amazon version It's not double sim
customer_reviews.text: The phone is great, the notch is great, everything is absolutely great. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because this version is not double sim as described on product page here on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas La Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I almost returned it because it doesn't do wireless charging, but I changed my mind because the phone is fantastic and for so little money! It has SO much memory that I can put anything on it without worry. I also bought a Samsung Galaxy Watch recently and the two bond so well without any disconnections. The screen is bright and clear and I LOVE the option to combine all your lower virtual buttons into one bar that makes maneuvering so easy and useful. You can't go wrong with this device. It's that's good.
customer_reviews.author: Angela HC

customer_reviews.title: Careful. You definitely get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: Fell off my dining room table onto the tile floor...it completely shattered. As in chunks of glass missing! I should've known better. Buy a quality phone and save yourself money. I just wanted a decent smart phone to last 2 years...it lasted 2 weeks. Poor construction.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Parrish

customer_reviews.title: Save your money to buy anything but this phone
customer_reviews.text: I guess one gets what we paid for. This is the worst phone I have ever used. To set the system right is excruciatingly painful, it is very user unfriendly and pain in the butt. I can't get message working and after looked online and tried to reset it for the past one week, I still couldn't get text message right. How frustrating! I highly do not recommend this phone to anybody. You end up saving time and money by other phone brand than this one. PS: I used all sorts of phones ranging from latest iphone to Nokia and a few other brands for the past two decades. This is the most painful phone ever I have to say.
customer_reviews.author: emilylund

customer_reviews.title: A phone is supposed to last more than three months!
customer_reviews.text: Three months after purchase my phone has gone bonkers! The screen freezes, apps crash and the phone turns off randomly even after being fully charged. My return window is closed and there seems to be no door of complaint available!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie-Anne Samuel

customer_reviews.title: It breaks the screen easily!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second purchase lol, we should've known better! My husband really likes the phone, and the fact that is pretty cheap compared to what is in the marketing right now is a plus, but he is a constructor, so the first one we bought it broke during work. This one though broke the screen within 3 weeks. it was in my husband's pocket and it fell right in the drivewalk. He is still using it. and the phone itself is great. I just wish the screen was a bit more sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: Wylian & Roberta

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price point
customer_reviews.text: I just needed a phone with decent storage and processing power at a reasonable price point and I got it with the Moto G7! It's not preloaded with a ton of bloatware, Amazon Alexa and related apps aside. Plenty of memory for me to download music and the like, and I haven't had an issue with the storage yet as I have seen in other reviews. If it does happen I will definitely be updating this review though! The screen display is smooth and clear and the apps load with very little lag; there is very little to complain about with this phone so far. I am quite happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Bk Rose

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is excellent
customer_reviews.text: Battery life has been as advertised. I have gone over 2 days on a single charge with moderate use. Only gripe I have is sometimes the phone will randomly stop sending text messages (I still receive messages but nothing sends...). Call quality is decent although it does seem to struggle with signal strength sometimes when my old phone used to be fine in that same location. Bluetooth range is atrocious compared to the G5 that this phone replaced. I'm assuming it has less power allocated to Bluetooth to support longer battery life? Overall I'm happy. I bought it for the long battery life and it has delivered.
customer_reviews.author: BRM

customer_reviews.title: Never getting another Motorola, that's for sure.
customer_reviews.text: This phone lacks so many basic features it boggles my mind. Guess they shoved everything out to fit an Alexa I never wanted. You can get a Galaxy J7 for cheaper than this, and I figured, why not? Let's spoil ourselves. Can't access my music from the lock screen. Doesn't bluetooth my info over to my car. Can't find anything. Battery life is crap. It's just a bad phone by today's standards. So I wouldn't recommend it to anyone because there are better phones on the market for cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Conner Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Good Phone But Has Some Limitations and Issues
customer_reviews.text: Good phone for a value phone. The good: (1) The price (2) Looks Great (3) Nice Sized Screen The not so good: (1) Battery Life (2) Randomly Freezes with screen off, only way I have found to get the phone unfrozen is to plug it in. (The battery is NOT dead). Concerns: The phone periodically (1-2x per week) when it goes to sleep will not wake up. The only solution that I have found is to plug the phone in and hit the power key then it wakes up.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic R.

customer_reviews.title: Good battery, bad camera, slow
customer_reviews.text: I have had the phone for two months. The camera is poor. The battery has good life. There is a very annoying error screen that keeps popping up about the Prime Video App not responding even though I am not using it. This is very annoying and It seems to pop up randomly without me opening the Prime Video App.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Best phone I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Love this phone. It is fast, minimal bloat-ware. has SD card memory. Nice clear display, intuitive interface and simpler than Samsung. All of this for under $180. Never used a Pixel phone so I can't comment on the camera quality, but it seems plenty good enough for me. I don't understand the complaints about battery life. In my regular daily use (phone, texting, email and a little surfing) I rarely use half the charge. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Honest John

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love it... But can't too many issues
customer_reviews.text: Junk haven't even had this phone 6 months and it has next to no battery life. Constantly freezes or the screen goes black. I can't use it while it's plugged in and charging or it freezes. Half the time it's plugged in it just randomly stops charging so I'll wake up after it had been on the charger all night to it at only a few percent. Apps constantly crash. Unable to use any kinda of mobile pay apps like Google pay cause it doesn't have those types of capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Yeager

customer_reviews.title: Great phone! Would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great phone for its price point. I like that you can use it on all four carriers, and that the phone seems to be solidly built. The screen is bright and looks really good, and the speaker doesn't sound amazing but it might be slightly above-average. The fingerprint sensor is incredibly accurate. I know there are some cheaper alternatives that can be competitive to this phone, but I like stock Android and a lot of Huawei and Xaomi phones don't offer that. Even in the case like the Xaomi Mi A2 which does have stock Android you could run into LTE band compatibility issues depending on where you live.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice phone but battery life is disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Got the phone as a replacement for my mother's moto G5. It's very similar, but bigger. Easy for the transition to the new phone. The battery lasts a day with light use - she makes a couple phone calls, some texting, reads some news, and checks facebook. No videos or games. Her old G5 battery was lasting 2 days between charges. Also, the most annoying thing about this phone is that the charging cord is not the standard connection. Had I known it would be a different charging cord than all the other devices, I probably would have gone with a different phone.
customer_reviews.author: KMG

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value at this price point.
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I was paying $8-900 for a phone when this phone does everything you need and the battery last for days and recharges in about an hour. Very solidy built and has a nice screen. Excellent value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: AF6NM

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for the money
customer_reviews.text: Honestly after my last phone bricked on me (Moto z4) I just wanted something that would work with a decent battery. Nothing fancy, and this is it. With light use battery goes for 4 days, heavy use 2 days. Has enough power processing wise to do what I need. Screen is nothing to write home about but still looks nice. Finger print reader on the back is a great touch. I would definitely recommend this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Van Loon

customer_reviews.title: Incredible phone for cheap...
customer_reviews.text: Having using these phones for some time it is nice to have a phone that does everything I need for so cheap, no contract. I almost consider these throw away phones at this point. Battery life is insane, I have yet to get close to running out of battery. It does everything that my Galaxies did except the the screen and the camera. The screen is no big deal, but the camera is the main drawback of these phones. I dont really use mine much but that is the only negative as far as I am concerned...
customer_reviews.author: John Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Impressive phone
customer_reviews.text: My old Motorola phone's battery was needing to be charged 2 times a day and it was getting some age on it so I looked at the reviews on this phone. The battery life is really amazing. I've only had to charge it twice in the past seven days and the screen size is a plus.I'm very happy with my purchase. Pros: Battery life,a decent camera,low price,larger screen,SD card slot,finger print sensor,fast battery charge,Republic cell compatible. Cons: Would like to be able to move more Apps to the sd card It's not a high tech performance phone but for the price you can't go wrong.I would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: R J Long

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is a joke
customer_reviews.text: The advertising stated the battery life is so much longer that prior models. That is not the truth. I have never had a phone that I have to plug in at least twice a day to keep charged. I charge my phone every night. This phone needs to be plugged in by the middle of the day. I've even had to order a different Jack so that I don't have to go put it in my bedroom to charge it quit. Big pain in the ass
customer_reviews.author: FireChiefsMom

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for me!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this phone because the BLU Grand XL wasn't updating security settings, causing U1 errors and had an older operating system. This Moto7 has the updated operating system and is clearly faster to respond. I ordered the U.S. version to use with Tracfone, (no problems) and took it to Central America last March. Worked well with MoviStar, a local carrier there. I would have liked to have the dual Nano SIM option, like the BLU I use the fingerprint reader with no problem, but did not activate the face feature (not sure how secure that is). I have had it for about five months and love it, but have not activated Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Qncy2011

customer_reviews.title: battery = awesome
customer_reviews.text: I get 2-3 days of heavy use... 5 to 6 days of normal use ... I would say this has 10x more battery life than my Galaxy S5 with a year old battery. - A little bigger than my S5 (would rather a smaller form factor) - looks good, takes better pictures - hotspot feature works fine - 2 chops for flashlight, 2 twirls for camera app, set with screen down for DND I very much like this phone. For the battery... how't this: 14 hours using Wayz and internet radio through bluetooth, screen on the entire time. I would get about 70 minutes of this with my old Galaxy S5.
customer_reviews.author: OC-Adam

customer_reviews.title: No Case No Headphones Cheap!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This phone works as any normal phone the battery is good but nothing outside of impressive they didn't include a case or headphones this is a really cheap move Motorola is the next blackberry and will be out of business soon
customer_reviews.author: AngevinVDVM

customer_reviews.title: Moto G continues to be our go-to affordable phone. Can't beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This one was purchased for my wife. Our 6th Moto G over time in the family. IIRC, our first was a G3. Our latest is a "power" (aka G8 I think). We've been happy with all of them. Whichever is the current generation is typically a solid middle-of-the-road phone with good memory, battery life, camera, screen size, etc. I say "good" not "great" on purpose. The moto G typically does everything "good" (nothing "great" nothing "bad") at a very moderate price. If you're a phone-fiend, if you must have a super-duper camera, if you must have the latest bestest screen... it's not for you. But you'll also spend a lot more to get that.
customer_reviews.author: KC Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good phone. The build materials and fit and finish are top notch. It has a great feel in hand. Battery life is great under normal usage. I can go all day, and have 30% of my battery life left, or more, when I get home. The camera is not great in low light, but very few phone cameras are. For average use, you don't need more phone. You can spend a lot more money to look at Face Book and Instagram, but why?
customer_reviews.author: Ramon

customer_reviews.title: Best phone I'v ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend. Great phone and super battery life. Have been using for a while with zero problems or issues. Love it. Also I recommend getting a good screen protector and case as this is a phone you'll want to protect. Per my experience I'd say buy with confidence. I purchased this case  and these screen protectors
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Drechsel-Turner

customer_reviews.title: Worse than "beginner" phone!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased MOTO G7 Power 2 mos. ago and love it. Found this one on Amazon and thought the add'l storage would be great...32 vs. 64 for aps needed when we travel in RV...so I ordered and gave the G7 Power to hubby. I mean, seriously, how much difference could there be between the 2 phones??!! After 5 hrs. of trying to get it to run to what I would consider "appropriate", I threw in the towel. On the positive side, well...um, it's cute. That's about it. Sorry. Processed return this morning and ordered another G7Power for me. I'll just have to be real careful on apps I download!
customer_reviews.author: Gloria

customer_reviews.title: SD card stucked in the sd/sim card slot.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very dissapointed. I took out the sd/sim card tray from the phone and carefully put a new micro SD card and a Sim card on the tray. Inserted the tray back in the phone, and then turned the phone on. The phone read the sim card (it accepted the cellular signal) nicely, but not the micro sd card. I turned off the phone and took the tray out. What a surprise, the micro sd card was not on the tray. It got stucked inside the slot. How can that happened? If you google "Moto G7 sd card stucked" you can see that quite a few people having the same issue. Did we get a defective phone?
customer_reviews.author: ozzy6364

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this one!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this just over a year ago. I have been fighting with bad cell service and thought it was my carrier. I changed carriers and it got worse. I constantly dropped to 3g or no internet at all. Decided to try my sim in an old phone due to some comments I saw online and I get great service. I did a factory reset reinserted my sim and still only 3g. Customer service awful. They want almost as much as a new to repair it. Wish I would have thought about bad service being the phone months ago when it was still covered. So much for motorola I'm going back to samsung.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work onAt&t or T-Mobile
customer_reviews.text: Nice phone, really great battery life, but it’s useless if it’s doesn’t support my provider. Does NOT work with AT&T and T-mobile. Hours spent with customer service of Amazon, customer service of Motorola, as well as couple days in AT&T and T-Mobile locations trying to make this phone work :( Maybe I got defective or locked phone, have no idea, but I don’t recommend it. Save your nerves.
customer_reviews.author: Mariya

customer_reviews.title: A bit buggy despite not being newly released
customer_reviews.text: Occasionally freezes and icons move around (had to lock Nova launcher). Bluetooth volume is low. Wifi on 5Ghz is not very strong. Battery is average at best but at least it charges very fast. G-cam from XDA works well. Alexa hands-free does not work reliably despite retaining. The Redmi Note 7 is better in nearly every way but does not have band 12, the long wavelength used for rural and indoor reception. The Moto also has band 66. There is no firewall for restricting apps to wifi. Debating whether to send it back. Might try a reset. I only paid $178 from Amazon w extra discount.
customer_reviews.author: Tab Numlock

customer_reviews.title: Was good for the first month
customer_reviews.text: From purchase to today (8-15-19 to 9-28-19), the phone was good for almost a month. Apps now constantly crash or lock up the phone necessitating reboots almost everyday. I've actually had to abandon several apps as they stopped working. Just now, I tried to access Facebook and the app crashed the entire phone and I am about to do a factory restore. Have reached out to several app manufacturers to help get apps working. Phone is up to date on software. Switched from Apple to Android-based and this is not a good introduction. Hopefully it's just the phone as my wife is loving her Google Pixel 3A.
customer_reviews.author: The Westbrooks

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cheap smart phone. Exactly what I wanted and very impressive. Switching to this phone was made very easy from my old Motorola. 8 months later and I have no complaints other than my speaker being broken, which is very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mrs. Parison

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PHONE FOR THE PRICE
customer_reviews.text: This phone is fantastic and has many cool features. I had intended to buy the dual SIM version but bought single SIM by mistake. It has a nice heavy feel to it as it is metal and has the features of more expensive phones. I am considering buying the dual SIM as this one is that good. Camera is pretty good but not exceptional and the battery is the best lasting up to 3 days.
customer_reviews.author: A. Pumarol

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: In the end you get what you pay for. My speaker blew within two months of owning the phone. The battery life is fantastic and a great selling point. All in all it's what you expect out of a budget phone. Not much processing power. Low video resolution. If you're just using your phone for social media and texts I'd expect you'd be fine. But anything out of those constructs is a no go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome battery, very fast processor....
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this phone. Battery lasts all day at work, (I use it a LOT, too!), and if I forget to charge it that night, no problem, because it will still have a good charge the NEXT NIGHT. AMAZING....My old Galaxy G6 would slow down and not want to run a lot of newer apps, but this phone runs everything......I'm going to get one for my wife...
customer_reviews.author: johnathan davis

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this phone
customer_reviews.text: I've been a fan of the Moto phones for years and wanted to trade up my G4, so I found this on Amazon prime day and got a great deal. It was very easy to transfer my Verizon number and transferred all my apps, etc. by Bluetooth. It's a great quality phone. I especially like the photo and video quality of the Moto phones. I am not using the Alexa function and it's easy to disable. My only complaint and it's not really a problem, is the phone is very sleek and quite slippery. It takes some getting used to, or a cover might be a good idea. Overall, a great phone for the money
customer_reviews.author: Rex The TV Terrier

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, battery not so much...
customer_reviews.text: First the bad news. I love the phone but the battery life is awful. I have Battery Saver on, and it still doesn't hold a charge. I can maybe get 4-6 hours on this phone. The only good thing is it's got a turbo charger. I also can't figure out how to set notifications for texts. Even with that, I really like this phone. The size is perfect. I love that I can access all my Amazon music, and the speaker is great. The camera is good, though I have a digital camera so I'm not too concerned about that. I've had it about 2 months now and I'm still learning how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: K. LORI

customer_reviews.title: Iphone users should stick with Apple
customer_reviews.text: As a android device I give it a 5 stars. As a phone, 2 stars. Battery life is great. Display is good. The problem I have with it is the reception and the phone. I have been on phone calls when another call came through and when I tried to switch to it the phone dropped both calls. Listening to streaming I have to hold the phone up in the air to keep it going. The resale value is 33% of what I paid for it 2 months after I bought it. I will admit I'm an iPhone user so maybe this is just my ignorance on android phones. I've gone back to Apple for all the reasons above.
customer_reviews.author: J. Griffiths

customer_reviews.title: Overall a great phone
customer_reviews.text: Very occasionally the phone shuts off and needs a hard (15 second hold) reboot. I never had that happen with previous MotoGs, however, other than that (and it doesn't happen often), the G7 is better imo. Use it for everything from recording interviews to writing to games, the camera is good (def not the BEST, especially for zoom, but for the price it's great), plenty of space, charges fast, tough screen, no issues if it gets wet (as in rain etc, never had it submerged). Overall I love the phone, but do have to dock a star for sometimes shutting off.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent battery life and clear bright screen
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Moto g7 to replace an old Samsung 5, which no longer held a battery charge for a full day, and was out of battery space. Still getting used to the new phone, and haven't found my ringtone source yet, but it does everything I need. I am not a power user; no video downloads, games, etc. But it does everything I need at 1/3 the price of a new Samsung.
customer_reviews.author: Jean S. Logan

customer_reviews.title: BEST phone I have owned! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
customer_reviews.text: The slick look of this phone is just the icing on the cake. Whether playing music, playing games, talking, texting, etc., this phone has incredible battery life. VERY SATISFIED!
customer_reviews.author: Viz

customer_reviews.title: This would be an excellent phone even at a higher price. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: A surprisingly excellent phone. I’ve been a hard core Apple user for years, but I needed a phone as a verizon hotspot for my RV to give me two carriers and remote access to security cameras. I picked this Moto G7 power for battery life but mainly because it had good reviews at a low price point. After a few hours playing with it, I can’t believe how far Android has evolved and how excellent this phone hardware is. Yes, the camera is not top notch, but it’s fine. Everything else including display and speed seem excellent. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Guru

customer_reviews.title: Great quality phone great price no problems
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone. Honestly I did go thru the storage space very quickly even tho it was double my last phone. But that's from all my photos and videos. It works great, has gave me no problems. Volume could be louder, it's kinda low. Battery life is alright, it charges super fast on the charger that came with it tho. Love the fingerprint reader. But the face recognition has never worked.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Bullard

customer_reviews.title: Case and screen breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: Back case cracked the first time I dropped it. Corner of screen broke the second time I dropped it. In other words, don't get this phone unless you get some sort of protection against this slick but impractical design... I came from a Moto 5 which was very forgiving about being dropped, given that it was metal. This one appears to be glass.
customer_reviews.author: msikky

customer_reviews.title: Great! Except....
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! Since I do not use it for calling every day and only connect to the internet when I am on home wifi the first full battery charge lasted about a week. Screen looks wonderful, plenty of storage space. I only have one issue and I think it has to do with the Kindle app, not the phone. Very often the Kindle app resets and I have to sign back into my Amazon account and re-download all my books and redo all my app settings. Besides the Kindle app issue though, I would recommend this to anyone. :)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer
